p: Vitamin C acts as an antioxidant and can boost the immune system [ 47]. It is involved in the function and integrity of mucosal cells, the normal functioning of T cells while it also exerts antimicrobial effects [ 37]. Vitamin C and concentration is high in leukocytes and it is utilized in the case of infection [ 48]. Vitamin C reduces the risk, the severity, and the duration of different infectious diseases, its status has been associated with pneumonia [ 49] and the supplementation with vitamin C may prevent and treat respiratory and systemic infections [ 47]. Therapeutic doses of vitamin C (24 gr/day intravenously, for seven days) are currently being tested in hospitalized COVID-19 patients [ 7]. However, official sources indicate that there is no evidence yet to support intravenous super doses of vitamin C in the management of COVID-19 [ 50].
